document.masterDocTitle: The family Cavognathidae (Coleoptera: Cucujoidea) in Argentina and adjacent countries

subSubSection.paragraph:
Cavognatha
sp.: Turienzo & Di Iorio 2008, 2010 (distribution; natural history)
“ Coleoptera [undetermined larvae]”: Di Iorio et al . 2008 (distribution; natural history)

Taphropiestes
sp.: Turienzo & Di Iorio 2011 (distribution; natural history)

Taphropiestes plaumanni : Turienzo & Di Iorio 2014
a (distribution; natural history); Turienzo & Di Iorio 2014 b (discussion)

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 2–4 .
Taphropiestes plaumanni
: 2, general aspect; 3, antenna (ventral view); 4, detail of head and prothorax.

FIGURE 5 . Geographic distribution of
Taphropiestes plaumanni
in Argentina (except Buenos Aires province): black circles, all localities in which bird nests were sampled by the present authors; red circles, localities of bird nests positive for
T. plaumanni
; yellow circle, positive bird nests mentioned in literature by other authors.

FIGURE 6. Geographic distribution of
Taphropiestes plaumanni
in Buenos Aires province (Argentina): black circles, all localities in which bird nests were sampled by the present authors; red circles, localities of bird nests sampled by the present authors positive for
T. plaumanni
; yellow circle, localities mentioned in literature (without bird hosts).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Note 1
. One paratype from Santa Catharina: Nova Teutonia was collected “in wilted leaf Caporeira ” [sic] (Ślipiński & Tomaszewska 2010 ). Caporeira (Portuguese) means a place with poor herbaceous and shrubby vegetation after the forest was logged, and not a name of a plant species.

Note 2
. Due to its presence in Santa Catarina (Ślipiński & Tomaszewska 2010 ),
T. plaumanni
is probably distributed also in Río Grande do Sul ( Brazil ), as well as in Uruguay , due to its nearness and similarity with the province of Entre Ríos and Buenos Aires.

Note 3
. The larval and pupal morphology of
T. plaumanni
remain undescribed.
